verses.kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, eat what you find. Eat this scroll, and go, speak to the house of Israel.”
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Son of man, eat what is in front of you. Eat this scroll, and then go speak to the house of Israel."

verses.kjv: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roll.
verses.web: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat the scroll.
verses.ct: So I opened my mouth, and he fed me the scroll.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, cause your belly to eat, and fill your bowels with this scroll that I give you.” Then I ate it; and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Son of man, fill your stomach — swallow down this scroll I'm giving you." So I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, go to the house of Israel, and speak my words to them.
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Son of man, go now to the house of Israel and speak my words to them.

verses.kjv: For thou art not sent to a people of a strange speech and of an hard language, but to the house of Israel;
verses.web: For you are not sent to a people of a strange speech and of a hard language, but to the house of Israel;
verses.ct: I'm not sending you to a foreign people who speak a strange language you can't understand. I'm sending you to the house of Israel —

verses.kjv: Not to many people of a strange speech and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened unto thee.
verses.web: not to many peoples of a strange speech and of a hard language, whose words you can’t understand. Surely, if I sent you to them, they would listen to you.
verses.ct: not to many nations with unfamiliar languages whose words make no sense to you. If I had sent you to people like that, they would actually listen to you.

verses.kjv: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.
verses.web: But the house of Israel will not listen to you, for they will not listen to me; for all the house of Israel are obstinate and hard-hearted.
verses.ct: But the house of Israel will refuse to listen to you, because they refuse to listen to me. Every last one of them is stubborn and hard-hearted.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have made thy face strong against their faces, and thy forehead strong against their foreheads.
verses.web: Behold, I have made your face hard against their faces, and your forehead hard against their foreheads.
verses.ct: So look — I've made your face just as hard as theirs, and your forehead just as stubborn as theirs.

verses.kjv: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they be a rebellious house.
verses.web: I have made your forehead as a diamond, harder than flint. Don’t be afraid of them, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.”
verses.ct: I've made your forehead like diamond, harder than flint. Don't be afraid of them, and don't be shaken by the way they look at you, even though they are a rebellious people."

verses.kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.
verses.web: Moreover he said to me, “Son of man, receive in your heart and hear with your ears all my words that I speak to you.
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Son of man, take every word I speak to you and store it deep in your heart. Listen carefully with your ears.

verses.kjv: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.
verses.web: Go to them of the captivity, to the children of your people, and speak to them, and tell them, ‘This is what the Lord LORD says,’ whether they will hear, or whether they will refuse.
verses.ct: Now go to the exiles — your own people — and speak to them. Tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says,' whether they listen or refuse to listen."

verses.kjv: Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of the LORD from his place.
verses.web: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me the voice of a great rushing, saying, “Blessed be LORD’s glory from his place.”
verses.ct: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a thunderous rushing sound that said, "Blessed be the glory of the LORD from his place!"

verses.kjv: I heard also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels over against them, and a noise of a great rushing.
verses.web: I heard the noise of the wings of the living creatures as they touched one another, and the noise of the wheels beside them, even the noise of a great rushing.
verses.ct: I heard the wings of the living creatures brushing against each other, and the rumble of the wheels beside them — a tremendous roaring sound.

verses.kjv: So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
verses.web: So the Spirit lifted me up, and took me away; and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; and LORD’s hand was strong on me.
verses.ct: The Spirit lifted me up and carried me away. I went with bitterness and a burning anger in my spirit, but the hand of the LORD gripped me powerfully.

verses.kjv: Then I came to them of the captivity at Telabib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.
verses.web: Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel Aviv, that lived by the river Chebar, and to where they lived; and I sat there overwhelmed among them seven days.
verses.ct: I arrived at Tel Abib, where the exiles lived by the Chebar River. I sat down among them right where they were, and for 7 days I stayed there, completely overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: At the end of seven days, LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: After those 7 days, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.
verses.web: “Son of man, I have made you a watchman to the house of Israel. Therefore hear the word from my mouth, and warn them from me.
verses.ct: "Son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the house of Israel. Whenever you hear a word from my mouth, you must warn them on my behalf.

verses.kjv: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.web: When I tell the wicked, ‘You will surely die;’ and you give him no warning, nor speak to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; that wicked man will die in his iniquity; but I will require his blood at your hand.
verses.ct: If I tell a wicked person, 'You are going to die,' and you don't warn him — if you say nothing to turn him from his wicked ways and save his life — that person will die for his sin, but I will hold you responsible for his death.

verses.kjv: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.web: Yet if you warn the wicked, and he doesn’t turn from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he will die in his iniquity; but you have delivered your soul.”
verses.ct: But if you do warn a wicked person and he still refuses to turn from his wickedness and his evil ways, he will die for his sin — but you will have saved your own soul."

verses.kjv: Again, When a righteous man doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumbling-block before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.web: “Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness, and commits iniquity, and I lay a stumbling block before him, he will die. Because you have not given him warning, he will die in his sin, and his righteous deeds which he has done will not be remembered; but I will require his blood at your hand.
verses.ct: "And if a righteous person turns away from doing right and starts committing sin, and I place an obstacle before him, he will die. Because you didn't warn him, he will die in his sin, and all the righteous things he once did will be forgotten. But I will hold you responsible for his death.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.web: Nevertheless if you warn the righteous man, that the righteous not sin, and he does not sin, he will surely live, because he took warning; and you have delivered your soul.”
verses.ct: However, if you warn that righteous person not to sin, and he listens and doesn't sin, he will certainly live because he accepted the warning — and you will have saved your own soul."

verses.kjv: And the hand of the LORD was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.
verses.web: LORD’s hand was there on me; and he said to me, “Arise, go out into the plain, and I will talk with you there.”
verses.ct: The hand of the LORD came upon me there, and he said, "Get up and go out to the plain. I will speak with you there."

verses.kjv: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the LORD stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I fell on my face.
verses.web: Then I arose, and went out into the plain, and behold, LORD’s glory stood there, like the glory which I saw by the river Chebar. Then I fell on my face.
verses.ct: So I got up and went out to the plain, and there stood the glory of the LORD — the same glory I had seen by the Chebar River. I fell facedown on the ground.

verses.kjv: Then the spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet, and spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thine house.
verses.web: Then the Spirit entered into me, and set me on my feet. He spoke with me, and said to me, “Go, shut yourself inside your house.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit entered me and stood me on my feet. He spoke to me and said, "Go and shut yourself inside your house.

verses.kjv: But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:
verses.web: But you, son of man, behold, they will put ropes on you, and will bind you with them, and you will not go out among them.
verses.ct: As for you, son of man — they will tie you up with ropes and bind you so that you cannot go out among the people.

verses.kjv: And I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are a rebellious house.
verses.web: I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth, that you will be mute, and will not be able to correct them; for they are a rebellious house.
verses.ct: I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so that you'll be unable to speak. You won't be able to confront them, because they are a rebellious people.

verses.kjv: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.
verses.web: But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall tell them, ‘This is what the Lord LORD says.’ He who hears, let him hear; and he who refuses, let him refuse; for they are a rebellious house.”
verses.ct: But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth, and you will tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says.' Whoever is willing to listen, let him listen. Whoever refuses, let him refuse — because they are a rebellious people."
